pinyin: Ying1 guo2 Huang2 jia1 Xue2 hui4

definition: United Kingdom/British/England/English/abbr. for 英國|英国[Ying1 guo2]

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: Story of Palaeobotany Series (Supplemental issue): How is the palaeobotany Fellow or Foreign Member of the Royal Society in London selected?
sentences.chinese: 英国皇家学会古植物学院士与外籍院士是如何遴选的？

sentences.english: The results are published in the Proceedings of the Royal Society.
sentences.chinese: 这一研究结果刊载于《英国皇家学会学报》。

sentences.english: I have just received the Royal Society King Charles II Medal.
sentences.chinese: 方才，英国皇家学会授予我“查理二世国王奖”。

sentences.english: Their work appears in the Proceedings of the Royal Society.
sentences.chinese: 他们的研究成果发表在《英国皇家学会会报》上。

sentences.english: Franklin was a member of Freemasonry , and was elected Fellow of the Royal Society of the United Kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 富兰克林是共济会的成员，被选为英国皇家学会院士。

definition: Sir Isaac Newton (1642-1727), British mathematician and physicist
Max Planck (1858-1947), German physicist who first postulated quantization of energy

definition: member of religious order/penitent/frater/translation of French agregé (holder of teaching certificate)
Henri Poincaré (1854-1912), French mathematician, physician and philosopher
Leibnitz (name)/Gottfriend Wilhelm von Leibniz (1646-1716), German mathematician and philosopher, co-inventor of the calculus
